thread.section_title: Tens of thousands sign up to march on Parliament in stop Brexit protest – Metro
thread.title: Tens of thousands sign up to march on Parliament in stop Brexit protest
thread.title_full: Tens of thousands sign up to march on Parliament in stop Brexit protest

author: tmeyjes
title: Tens of thousands sign up to march on Parliament in stop Brexit protest
text:
More than 26,000 have said they’d attend the Stop Brexit march (Picture: AFP/Getty Images) Tens of thousands of people have signed up to attend a march to demand Britain remains in the European Union. 
The Unite for Europe march is timed to coincide with the end-of-March deadline the Government has set for the activation of Article 50 and the start of formal Brexit negotiations.
One of the world's greatest brains calls on Jeremy Corbyn to step down It has the stated aim of emboldening MPs to stop the EU-leaving process and so far gathered the support of more than 26,000 people.
The March 25 protest has also been timed to coincide with the 60th anniversary of the signing of the Treaty of Rome to establish the European Economic Community (EEC)
The march, which will leave from Hyde Park for Parliament, is the latest in a string of protests opposing Brexit that have taken place since Britain voted Leave in the EU referendum.
The protest will take place on the 60th anniversary of the signing of the Treaty of Rome (Picture: Getty Images) The campaigners believe MPs can stop Brexit (Picture:Getty Images) However, as yet, none have been able to sway enough MPs to go against the result to scupper government intentions to leave the European Union by 2019.
A Brexit Bill which will give the Government powers to enact Article 50 was voted through by the House of Commons, which will have to vote again on a Lords amendment seeking guaranteed rights for EU citizens.
But in a statement on its website Unite for Europe said it believed Brexit could be stopped.
It said: ‘We can embolden our elected representatives, the vast majority of our MPs support our membership of the European Union, but are being railroaded into a catastrophe by reckless and incompetent leadership.
‘There is a long, unpredictable, road ahead that Parliament will have some control over; they need to know just how many votes there are in adopting a pro-EU position. With our vocal support, they can stop Brexit.
The Government is aiming to trigger Article 50 by the end of the month (Photo by Jack Taylor/Getty Images) MPs are currently deliberating the Brexit Bill (Picture: JUSTIN TALLIS/AFP/Getty Images) ‘We can change minds. As the damage of an impending Brexit reveals itself over the coming months, we can help sway public opinion with our demonstration of support for the European Union and all its benefits.’
 
To find out more visit .
